p: As with total phenols, the amount of flavonoids in the extracts was dependent on the drying methodology ranging from 11.3 to 28.2 mg QE/g of the extract. Similarly, the extract from microwave dried leaves showed a higher flavonoids content (p < 0.05). As compared to air dried leaves, microwave drying increased 1.5 times the concentration of flavonoids in M. communis L. leaves extract.
